intro: Cyrtandra nodulosa, commonly known as the nodular cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. Cyrtandra nodulosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
